schema.name: Healthyfied Wagyupsal

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, tomatoes, and lettuce under cold water. Pat them dry.
Slice the sweet capsicum, orange capsicum, red mushrooms, and tomatoes into bite-sized pieces.
Chop the fresh thyme and rosemary.
In a large bowl, mix the sliced vegetables, minced garlic, chopped thyme, chopped rosemary, and salt. Let it marinate for about 10 minutes.
Slice the Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef into thin slices.
Preheat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the marinated vegetables for about 5 minutes until they're slightly charred and tender, then remove and set aside.
In the same pan, grill the Wagyu beef slices for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they reach your desired doneness.
Serve the grilled Wagyu beef alongside the grilled vegetables, fresh lettuce, and kimchi. Enjoy your Healthyfied Wagyupsal.

schema.description: Indulge in a high-protein, low-carb, high-fiber, and high-sodium culinary masterpiece with our Healthyfied Wagyupsal recipe. Perfect for health-conscious individuals looking to enjoy luxurious flavors without guilt, this dish combines Japanese Wagyu Kobe Beef with a vibrant mix of fresh vegetables and kimchi. Each bite promises a burst of rich flavor and a multitude of health benefits, making it a standout addition to any healthy recipe collection.
